Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2007 04:58AM - edited Sep 28, 2007 04:58AM by ruths2 Some people are talking about this new metronomic chemotherapy.  My new onc says it's very low dose C and M (as in CMF) with Avastin every day. It's supposed to be less toxic and is showing some promise. Check out this link for more info: http://www.medscape.com/viewarticle/480745_2

Posts.Title: Skin mets???? ruths2 cewoliver

Posts.Content: ruths2 wrote: So, I saw my new onc and she was concerned about a patch of pimple-like bumps on my cheek.  They started as tiny pimples by my nose in July and have gotten bigger and spread out over most of my cheek.  I've used every kind of ointment know to pharmacology and nothing makes them go away completely. Sometimes they almost disappear and other times they are pretty obvious.  Anyway, she wanted me to see a dermatologist ASAP, but they can't get me in until October 9th.  So, I come here to see if anyone has ever heard of such a thing? Basically it looks like I have pimples on wrinkles...how unfair is that????  At 48 I though my acne days were over :) Ruth Dx Stage IV, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Skin mets???? ruths2 cewoliver

Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2007 08:31AM ruths2 wrote: So, the results of my MRI are in.  All lesions that showed up on the CT scan (and NOT on the bone scan) were identified on the MRI.  They are not a "typical presentation" for bone mets, but one on my sacrum is highly suspicious.  They want to start me on Zometa which I think is a good idea.  Nothing about my cancer has been typical.  It never showed up on mamo or ultrasound and when they finally saw the palpable lump on MRI I already had 13 normal sized lymph nodes completely replaced by cancer.  Today, I feel really tired....   Ruth
Posts.Title: Conflicting results: CT and Bone scan ruths2 ruths2

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2007 07:13AM ruths2 wrote: This is my first time being checked out for suspected mets. I had the rib xray this morning. My onc nurse said the doc will call be after he compares the film to the bone scan. I asked the nurse about an MRI and she said I'll have to talk to the doc about that. Ahhhhh...this waiting is so hard.
Posts.Title: Conflicting results: CT and Bone scan ruths2 ruths2

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2007 12:45AM ruths2 wrote:
Posts.Title: Conflicting results: CT and Bone scan ruths2 ruths2

Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2007 01:10PM ruths2 wrote: No one has mentioned a biopsy yet.  I know my onc was consulting with the director of oncology. My doctor seemed to favor a watch, wait, and follow-up scans approach.  I asked him directly if I have metastatic bone disease and he said he can't say one way or the other.  Hopefully I will hear their combined recommendations tomorrow or Tuesday.  I told my kids (24 and 26) that there is something suspicious on my spine but hopefully it's ok.  I tried to downplay it as much as possible.  Worrying them is the hardest part for me.  I didn't even want to tell them, but I remembered that we all need the truth and I wanted them to hear it from me.  I'm feeling pretty lonely with this whole thing.  My husband is warm and loving (we were just married in March) but I see the concern in his eyes and I just wish we didn't have to deal with cancer.  All I can really do is take the next step in front of me on this journey.  I'm very grateful to have loving people in my life. Thanks for sharing your thoughts and ideas on this board.  I feel like a member of the communty and it helps :)
Posts.Title: Conflicting results: CT and Bone scan ruths2 ruths2

Posts.Content: ruths2 wrote: Hi ladies- It has come to my attention that my husband's ex-wife (divorced 6 years ago)  Goggled my name and found my postings here.  She must have actually signed up because only members can see our pictures, right? She left him a really snotty message about how his new wife (we've been married 7 months) is Stage IV and a goner!  She also made a negative comment about our wedding picture which I use as an avatar.  Isn't it unfortunate the lengths people will go to perpetuate pain and bitterness.  I now know that everything I write will be used to hurt my dear husband.  I wish Google did not bring her here. Ruth Update: 8/25/08 This is my old screen name. I did change to a new one a year or so ago, but I revived this name because I have discovered that the same intruder is still trolling our boards attempting to follow my progress and eagerly anticipating my demise.  Please be careful about the amount of personal information you disclose in your posting.  You never know about the wierdos out there. Dx Stage IV, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: ruths2 wrote: Hi Ladies, I've been reading and posting on these boards as a Stage 3C gal for a couple years. Well, this week I had a CAT scan that showed "Findings worrisome for new blastic skeletal metastesis involving L1,L2,L5, the right side of S1, the right acetabulum superiorly, and the right side of the publis symphasis. Total body scan suggested." So... I had the bone scan and it said "No foci of radiotracer uptake identified in L1, L2, L5 or S1 to correspond the the sclerotic lesions indentified on the CT examination." There was, however increased radiotracer on the left anterior second rib. They are sending me for X-rays to get the rib scheked out. How can this be that two tests coulde be so different? Do I have mets or not? I really scared and I have to wait until Monday to talk to the Doctor... I think I'll dig out my bottle of Xanax Ruth Dx Stage IV, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Conflicting results: CT and Bone scan ruths2 ruths2

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2007 07:53PM - edited Oct 6, 2007 07:54PM by ruths2 Hi mj- I just wanted to share with you that I found out about mets in my lumbar spine, pelvis, sacrum, and public bone just a few weeks ago.  I was a mess, but the ladies here have been so great.  I was told that pretty soon I will "stand up, dust myself off, and get on with life."  You know what, already I can feel it happening.  I started taking Wellbutrin (which is helping me feel like leaving the house again), made a therapy appointment, and am feeling more like myself.  I am scared, but I just don't want stay in that bleak place indefinitely.  You are in the right place here...there are very kind and wise women here. Ruth
Posts.Title: scan results..numb beyond belief mjcs7 KariLynn

Posts.Content: ruths2 wrote: So, the nurse called me today to say that the Director of Oncology reviewed my case and she wants to look at my scans with the radiologist before starting any kind of treatment besides the tamoxifen I already take.  She is not convinced yet that what I have is mets.  What else could cause blastic lesions on 4 vertebra, hipbone, and public bone?  Could it possibly be something besides cancer?  I sure would like to stay Stage IIIC a little longer...I cant believe I would ever be saying that   Dx Stage IV, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: ok, one more question... ruths2 LuAnnH
